snippet: Four people were struck and killed in crashes over the weekend, coinciding with Mayor Bill de Blasio’s call on Friday to end the “epidemic” of traffic violence in New York City.
abstract: Four traffic fatalities in two days in New York City highlight scourge that Mayor Bill de Blasio has committed his administration to preventing.

byline.contributor: Annie Correal and Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Four people were struck and killed in crashes over the weekend, coinciding with Mayor Bill de Blasio’s call on Friday to end the “epidemic” of traffic violence in New York City.

headline.main: Four Traffic Fatalities in Two Days As Mayor Vows to Make Streets Safer
headline.print_headline: Four Traffic Fatalities in Two Days as Mayor Vows to Make Streets Safer
